SEARCH
Module JNewton
Package crab.newton

Class NewtonBody

java.lang.Object
crab.newton.NewtonBody
public final class NewtonBody extends Object
NewtonBody relies on preview features of the Java platform:
  • NewtonBody refers to one or more preview APIs: MemorySegment, SegmentScope.
Programs can only use NewtonBody when preview features are enabled.
Preview features may be removed in a future release, or upgraded to permanent features of the Java platform.

  • Constructor Details

    • NewtonBody

      public NewtonBody(MemorySegmentPREVIEW address)
      public constructor of the NewtonBody class. This constructor is meant to be used in callback methods such as in NewtonApplyForceAndTorque when the NewtonBody is a raw address. Creation of NewtonBodies should only happen with the NewtonWorld body create methods. Supplying an address that isn't an already existing NewtonBody instance may result in a crash or undefined behavior.
      Parameters:
      address - address of the NewtonBody

    • NewtonBody

      protected NewtonBody(MemorySegmentPREVIEW address, int bodyType)

  • Method Details

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object object)
      Test if object is equal to this NewtonBody.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      object -
      Returns:
      true if object is an instance of NewtonBody with the same address and bodyType.

    • getSimulationState

      public int getSimulationState()
      Gets the simulation state of the body
      Returns:
      0 if body is disabled or 1 if body is active

    • setSimulationState

      public void setSimulationState(int state)
      Sets the simulation state of the body
      Parameters:
      state - 0 to disable body | 1 to activate body

    • getCollidable

      public int getCollidable()
      Checks if the NewtonBody is collidable
      Returns:
      1 if true | 0 if false

    • setCollidable

      public void setCollidable(int collidableState)
      Sets the collidable state of the NewtonBody
      Parameters:
      collidableState - 1 for true | 0 for false

    • addForce

      public void addForce(MemorySegmentPREVIEW force)
      Adds the net force applied to the NewtonBody. The MemorySegment holding the force vector is expected to have an equivalent layout to the Newton.VEC3F MemoryLayout. This method is only effective when called from NewtonApplyForceAndTorque callback.
      Parameters:
      force - MemorySegment containing the force vector

    • addForce

      public void addForce(float[] force)
      Adds the net force applied to the NewtonBody. The float array must have a length greater than or equal to 3. This method is only effective when called from NewtonApplyForceAndTorque callback.
      Parameters:
      force - float[] containing the force vector

    • addTorque

      public void addTorque(MemorySegmentPREVIEW torque)
      Adds the net torque applied to the NewtonBody. The MemorySegment holding the torque vector is expected to have an equivalent layout to the Newton.VEC3F MemoryLayout. This method is only effective when called from NewtonApplyForceAndTorque callback.
      Parameters:
      torque - MemorySegment containing the torque vector

    • addTorque

      Parameters:

    • setMassMatrix

      public void setMassMatrix(float mass, float Ixx, float Iyy, float Izz)
      Sets the mass matrix of the NewtonBody
      Parameters:
      mass - the mass of the NewtonBody
      Ixx - moment of inertia of the first principal axis
      Iyy - moment of inertia of the second principal axis
      Izz - moment of inertia of the third principal axis

    • setFullMassMatrix

      public void setFullMassMatrix(float mass, MemorySegmentPREVIEW inertiaMatrix)
      Sets the mass matrix of the NewtonBody. The MemorySegment containing the matrix should have an equivalent layout to the Newton.MAT4F MemoryLayout. The matrix should be in column-major order.
      Parameters:
      mass - the mass of the NewtonBody
      inertiaMatrix - MemorySegment containing the inertia matrix

    • setFullMassMatrix

      public void setFullMassMatrix(float mass, float[] inertiaMatrix)
      Sets the mass matrix of the NewtonBody. The float array must have a length greater than or equal to 16. The matrix should be in column-major order.
      Parameters:
      mass - the mass of the NewtonBody
      inertiaMatrix - float[] containing the inertia matrix

    • setMatrixRecursive

    • setMaterialGroupdID

      public void setMaterialGroupdID(int id)
      Assigns a material group id to the NewtonBody
      Parameters:
      id - material group id

    • setContinuousCollisionMode

      public void setContinuousCollisionMode(int state)
      Sets the continuous collision mode for the NewtonBody. The continuous collision mode for the NewtonBody is set to off by default. If continuous collision is activated the physics engine will perform predictive calculations to prevent high speed bodies from clipping. This is recommended to be activated for small, high speed bodies.
      Parameters:
      state - 1 for active | 0 for disabled

    • setJointRecursiveCollision

      public void setJointRecursiveCollision(int state)
      Sets the collision state flag of this NewtonBody when the body is connected to another body by a hierarchy of joints.
      Parameters:
      state - 1 this body will collide with any linked body | 0 disable collisions with body connected to this one by joints

    • setLinearDamping

      public void setLinearDamping(float linearDamp)
      Applies the linear viscous dampening coefficient to the NewtonBody.
      Parameters:
      linearDamp - the linear damping coefficient. The value is clamped between 0.0 and 1.0. The default value is 0.1

    • setAngularDamping

      public void setAngularDamping(MemorySegmentPREVIEW angularDamping)
      Applies the angular viscous dampening coefficient to the NewtonBody.
      Parameters:
      angularDamping - MemorySegment containing the angular damping coefficients of the principal axis of the NewtonBody

      collision - to used by the body

    • setCollisionScale

      public void setCollisionScale(float scaleX, float scaleY, float scaleZ)
      Sets the collision scale of the collision used by the NewtonBody.
      Parameters:
      scaleX - scale for the x-axis
      scaleY - scale for the y-axis
      scaleZ - scale for the z-axis

    • getSleepState

      public int getSleepState()
      Gets the sleep state of the NewtonBody.
      Returns:
      0 for active | 1 for sleeping

    • setSleepState

      public void setSleepState(int state)
      Sets the sleep state of the NewtonBody.
      Parameters:
      state - 0 for active | 1 for sleeping

    • getAutoSleepState

      public int getAutoSleepState()
      Gets the auto-activation state of the NewtonBody. Auto-activation is enabled by default.
      Returns:
      1 for auto-activation on | 0 for auto-activation off

    • setAutoSleepState

      public void setAutoSleepState(int state)
      Sets the auto-activation state of the NewtonBody. Auto-activation is enabled by default.
      Parameters:
      state - 1 for auto-activation on | 0 for auto-activation off

    • getFreezeState

      public int getFreezeState()
      Gets the freeze state of the NewtonBody. The freeze attribute determines whether the NewtonBody is actively simulated.
      Returns:
      1 for frozen | 0 for unfrozen

    • setFreezeState

      public void setFreezeState(int state)
      Sets the freeze state of the NewtonBody. The freeze attribute determines whether the NewtonBody is actively simulated.
      Parameters:
      state - 1 for frozen | 0 for unfrozen

      gyroscopic torque

      NewtonBodyDestructor callback assigned to the body

      public int getContinuousCollisionMode()
      Gets the continuous state mode for the NewtonBody. This is disabled by default.
      Returns:
      1 for active | 0 for disabled

    • getJointRecursiveCollision

      public int getJointRecursiveCollision()
      Gets the collision state flag of this NewtonBody when the body is connected to another body by a hierarchy of joints.
      Returns:
      1 this body will collide with any linked body | 0 disable collisions with body connected this one by joints

    • getPosition

      public void getPosition(MemorySegmentPREVIEW position)
      Gets the position of the NewtonBody in the NewtonWorld and stores it in the provided MemorySegment. The MemorySegment should have an equivalent layout to the Newton.VEC3F MemoryLayout.
      Parameters:
      position - MemorySegment to hold the position

    • getPosition

      public float[] getPosition()
      Gets the position of the NewtonBody in the NewtonWorld and returns it in a float[]. The float array will contain the x, y, z of the position in that order.
      Returns:
      float[] containing the body position

    • getMatrix

      public void getMatrix(MemorySegmentPREVIEW matrix)
      Gets the transformation matrix of the NewtonBody and stores it in the provided MemorySegment. The MemorySegment should have an equivalent layout to the Newton.MAT4F MemoryLayout. The matrix will be stored in column-major order.
      Parameters:
      matrix - MemorySegment to hold the matrix

    • getMatrix

      public float[] getMatrix()
      Gets the transformation matrix of the NewtonBody and returns it in a float[]. The float array will hold the matrix in column-major order
      Returns:
      float[] containing the body transformation matrix

    • getRotation

      public void getRotation(MemorySegmentPREVIEW rotation)
      Gets the rotation part of the transformation matrix as a unit quaternion and stores it in the provided MemorySegment. The MemorySegment should have an equivalent layout to the Newton.VEC4F MemoryLayout.
      Parameters:
      rotation - MemorySegment to hold the rotation

    • getRotation

      public float[] getRotation()
      Gets the rotation part of the transformation matrix as a unit quaternion and returns it in a float[]. The float array will contain the x, y, z, w of the rotation in that order.
      Returns:
      float[] containing the rotation

    • getMass

      public void getMass(MemorySegmentPREVIEW mass, MemorySegmentPREVIEW Ixx, MemorySegmentPREVIEW Iyy, MemorySegmentPREVIEW Izz)
      Gets the mass matrix of the NewtonBody. All MemorySegment parameters should have a layout of Newton.C_FLOAT.
      Parameters:
      mass - MemorySegment to hold the mass
      Ixx - MemorySegment to hold the moment of inertia for the first principal axis of inertia
      Iyy - MemorySegment to hold the moment of inertia for the second principal axis of inertia
      Izz - MemorySegment to hold the moment of inertia for the third principal axis of inertia

    • getMass

      public float[] getMass()
      Gets the mass matrix of the NewtonBody. This method doesn't return a full matrix but the mass and first, second, and third principal axis of inertia as four separate floats in the array.
      Returns:
      float[] containing the mass matrix

    • getInverseMass

      public void getInverseMass(MemorySegmentPREVIEW invMass, MemorySegmentPREVIEW invIxx, MemorySegmentPREVIEW invIyy, MemorySegmentPREVIEW invIzz)
      Gets the inverse mass matrix of the NewtonBody. All MemorySegment parameters should have a layout of Newton.C_FLOAT.
      Parameters:
      invMass - MemorySegment to hold the inverse mass
      invIxx - MemorySegment to hold the moment of inertia inverse for the first principal axis of inertia
      invIyy - MemorySegment to hold the moment of inertia inverse for the second principal axis of inertia
      invIzz - MemorySegment to hold the moment of inertia inverse for the third principal axis of inertia

    • getInverseMass

      public float[] getInverseMass()
      Gets the inverse mass matrix of the NewtonBody. This method doesn't return a full matrix but the mass and first, second, and third principal axis of inertia as four separate floats in the array.
      Returns:
      float[] containing the inverse mass matrix
